metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2977 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel implementation of proxied virtualizedTPM devices. On a system where virtualized TPM devices are configured (thisis not the default) a local attacker can create a use-after-free and createa situation where it may be possible to escalate privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
